content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Processing Facility
Consists of the following entities:
- Iron Furnace at position (0.0, 0.0) fueled with coal, processing iron ore.
- Wooden Chest at position (2.5, 0.5) used for storing processed items.
- Burner Inserter at position (1.5, 0.5) transferring items from the furnace to the chest.
- Transport Belt from position (3.5, 0.5) to (5.5, 0.5) moving items to further processing.
- Burner Inserter at position (3.5, 0.5) waiting for source items, connected to the transport belt.

### Copper Processing Facility
Consists of the following entities:
- Copper Furnace at position (10.0, 0.0) fueled with coal, processing copper ore.
- Burner Inserter at position (8.5, 0.5) transferring items from the chest to the furnace.
- Wooden Chest at position (7.5, 0.5) used for storing processed items.
- Burner Inserter at position (11.5, 0.5) waiting for source items to transfer to the next stage.

### Coal Mining and Storage Facility
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (41.0, -82.0) extracting coal.
- Wooden Chest at position (40.5, -83.5) storing extracted coal.
- Transport Belt from position (40.5, -83.5) to (38.5, -83.5) moving coal to storage.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when attempting to extract or insert items
- Ensure the target entity contains the required items before attempting to extract or insert. Verify that the inventory is not empty.

### Errors when placing entities
- Confirm that there is sufficient space and no existing objects at the target location before placing a new entity. Check inventory to ensure the entity is available for placement.

### Errors with inserters waiting for source items
- Make sure the source entity has items available for the inserter to transfer. Regularly check and restock source inventories to prevent idle inserters.

### Errors due to full inventory
- Regularly monitor and manage inventories to prevent overflow. Ensure there is enough space in the destination entity before transferring items.

### Errors with blocked paths or destinations
- Ensure that the path or destination for item transfer is clear and not obstructed by other entities. Regularly check and clear any blockages to maintain smooth operation.

### Errors with missing entities at specified positions
- Verify the presence of entities at specified positions before attempting operations like insertion or extraction. Use the map data to confirm entity locations.

### Errors when attempting to place entities on occupied tiles
- Always check if the tile is free before placing an entity to avoid conflicts with existing structures.
